content: doomslug the destroyer as of june 2024 originally released at the 2021 dragonsteel event from the cytoverse series by brandon sanderson from the mem s fussy links workshop now you too can have a slug drive in your pocket brandon sanderson and dragonsteel own all copyrights in the doomslug creature and any visual/physical representations of the doomslug creature i created the pattern/directions and own all copyrights in them i authorize use of my pattern/directions for making doomslug but you may not directly or indirectly sell the pattern itself this pattern is worked in the round stitch markers are used strategically in the pattern they are called for in the row and the picture tutorial has them included for clarity you can use stitch markers contrasting yarn or just keep track of the stitches yourself remove stitch markers once there is a stitch on the loop level of experience recommended all levels assume that the crafter has an internet connection to youtube tutorials and a search engine just in case the description is what the maker should already know or be willing to look up ambitious beginner level 1 5 primarily single_crochet increase and decrease but may have other stitches and color changing there s also sewing originally this pattern was made with size 4 worsted yarn and an f 3 75 mm hook - if your hook and yarn match though this pattern can be executed with any size yarn a picture tutorial is available after the written pattern abbreviations in us terms st = stitch yo = yarn over mc = magic_ring il = inner loops ol = outer loops fo = fasten_off wie = weave in ends chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet increase = increase decrease = decrease specialty stitches decrease x3 = insert hook through the outer loops of the next 3 st yo draw through all three loops yo draw through both loops on hook surface single_crochet or slip_stitch = crochet through spaces on the piece rather than along the row as usual you will need yarn colors color a for the body yellow in original pattern color b for the contrasting color blue in original pattern notions yarn and hook that match yarn needle stitch markers stuffing scissors safety eyes 9mm alternative alligator clip to be sewn onto the bottom to perch her on your shoulder large safety pin to be sewn onto the bottom to perch her on your shoulder written pattern body bolding is used to help separate and clarify instructions with yellow a yarn begin row 1 mc x7 7 pull tight row 2 increase in each stitch around 14 row 3 1 single_crochet increase x7 21 row 4 2 single_crochet increase x7 28 row 5 single_crochet around 28 row 6 single_crochet around 28 mark a few posts on this row it s where the eyes go row 7 single_crochet around 28 row 8 7 single_crochet decrease seven times in a row 7 single_crochet 21
